metadata.description: Personal collection manager for Claude Code configurations. Manages Skills, Commands, Agents, MCP servers, and Hooks across multiple projects with version control and deployment capabilities.
metadata.author: Nick Miethe

Artifact manager for Claude Code across multiple projects
Unified skill, command, and agent management system

PROJECT_ARCHITECTURE.description: SkillMeat's three-tier system architecture for artifact management and deployment
PROJECT_ARCHITECTURE.default: Collection (Personal Library) → Projects (Local .claude/ directories) → Deployment Engine → User/Local Scopes
examples: GitHub Source → Validator → Installer → Local Scopes

LAYER_ARCHITECTURE.description: Detailed breakdown of SkillMeat architectural layers from source to deployment
LAYER_ARCHITECTURE.default:
1. Source Layer (GitHub, local sources)
2. Validator Layer (SKILL.md validation, YAML parsing)
3. Storage Layer (Manifest, LockFile, SnapshotManager)
4. Core Layer (Collection, Artifact, Deployment, Sync, Version managers)
5. CLI Layer (Click commands, Rich formatting)
6. Installer Layer (Installation to user/local scopes, atomic operations)
7. Config Layer (Configuration management, GitHub tokens)
8. Integration Layer (Claude Marketplace registration, future MCP servers)
examples: 8-layer: Source → Validator → Storage → Core → CLI → Installer → Config → Integration
Source → Installation → Scope Management → Marketplace Registration
GitHub Client → Manifest Parser → Atomic Installer → User Scope Deployment

notes.IMPORTANT_NOTES: This configuration is customized for SkillMeat - a personal collection manager for Claude Code configurations. It reflects the three-tier architecture (Collection → Projects → Deployment), Python tech stack (3.9+), and CLI-first approach with future web interface. Current focus is Phase 1 MVP (skills only, with collection management foundation).
notes.SKILLMEAT_SPECIFICS: SkillMeat is transitioning from 'skillman' (skills-only tool) to a unified artifact manager. Current: Skills management via GitHub integration with manifest/lock files. Future: Commands, Agents, MCP servers, Hooks support. Phases: 1-Collection/Versioning, 2-Cross-project search, 3-Web interface/marketplace.
notes.USAGE: All configuration variables with {{VARIABLE}} placeholders should be replaced with SkillMeat-specific values. See CLAUDE.md for project-specific guidance, architecture details, and development patterns. Update settings.json and settings.local.json for Claude Code permissions and hooks.
notes.KEY_PATHS: Main code: skillman/ | Tests: tests/ (unit/, integration/, fixtures/) | Config: ~/.skillman/ (current) → ~/.skillmeat/ (future) | Project manifests: skills.toml + skills.lock | User scope: ~/.claude/skills/user/ | Local scope: ./.claude/skills/
notes.CUSTOMIZATION_GUIDE: For SkillMeat-specific customization, see CLAUDE.md in project root. For comprehensive customization across projects, see claude-export/ TEMPLATIZATION_GUIDE.md.
notes.TECH_STACK_SUMMARY: Backend: Python 3.9+ with Click (CLI), GitPython (GitHub), Rich (formatting), tomli/tomllib (TOML). Testing: pytest >80% coverage. Quality: Black, flake8, mypy full coverage. Packaging: setuptools/build, PyPI distribution. Future (Phase 3): FastAPI backend, React frontend, SQLite database.
NEXT_STEPS: 1. Review CLAUDE.md for SkillMeat-specific architecture and development workflow
2. Understand three-tier system: Collection → Project → Deployment
3. Familiarize with key patterns: Manifest structure, GitHub specs, Installer atomicity
4. Review existing models (Skill, Manifest, LockFile) and CLI commands
5. Test workflow: pip install -e .[dev] → pytest → black/flake8/mypy
6. For new features, follow Python standards (type hints, docstrings, tests)
7. For Phase 1 completion: focus on collection management, artifact versioning
8. For Phase 2+: implement cross-project search, smart updates, web interface
